revised_title: Magnetic Surveys and Local Disturbances in the Voyage of H.M.S. "Penguin"
tldr: This article discusses the magnetic surveys and local disturbances observed during the voyage of H.M.S. "Penguin" from 1890-93. The author, Captain E. W. Creak, describes the instruments used, observations made, and the importance of understanding local magnetic disturbances for navigation and scientific research. The findings contribute to the knowledge of magnetic elements and their disturbances in various locations, particularly in the coasts of Australia and undersea landforms.
